commit_message:
Final Mitaka release for python-saharaclient

It enables new cluster verification feature and new client version needed for
it's support on the dashboard site.

Global req change: Ibef97661a209e6b55d7d4183c41a96013352e0d7

Change-Id: Ia1bfa04a00068bc27f24ca3ce8cf5e34ff23bdee

commit_message:
Fix regression in interactive client mode

Fix typo introduced in OSprofiler intergation commit, that
leaded to non-working interactive mode of the CLI client.

Closes-Bug: 1551160

commit_message:
Update default FUEL_WEB_ROOT value for convenience

Usually fuel-* repos in development environment are stored in the
same dir, so this commits updates the default value accordingly.

Change-Id: I920eb58bc776f17908dcd1412b58eece93a0ef63
Implements: blueprint separate-fuel-ui-repo

commit_message:
Network verification for SR-IOV enabled interfaces

Skip "Private" network in network verification after deployment

Related to blueprint support-sriov
Change-Id: Ib710bad79bb3080c57e3d28033c55708957c71ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/03/285403/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # After deployment we can't check VLAN traffic on SR-IOV # enabled interface. So we should skip "Private" network from # network verification after deployment. if ng.name == consts.NETWORKS.private and \ iface.interface_properties['sriov']['enabled']: continue

tox version (nova, neutron), so we should probably do the
same.

commit_message:
Make ceph jobs non-voting until bug 1551305 is fixed

The gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ceph job is at a 25% fail
rate right now [1].

There was a librados package update from ubuntu on
2/24 which has at least one known regression in it [2].

Since we're in feature freeze week and this job is failing
badly and is voting on at least 5 projects (nova, glance,
cinder, os-brick, glance_store), make it non-voting while
ubuntu works on patching the package.

[1] http://tinyurl.com/z5qcbch
[2] http://tracker.ceph.com/issues/13757

Change-Id: I4cd019ce3461a4eb48d8e27288cd5a6ae4039d3f
Related-Bug: #1551305
Related-Bug: #1549854
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/42/286642/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(mriedem): Make the ceph jobs voting again after bug 1551305 is fixed. - name: ^gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ceph.*$ voting: false

commit_message:
Re-add str_replace parameter validation, and fix test

This partially reverts https://review.openstack.org/#/c/275602/, which
removed the validation of the parameters argument completely, but a
comment added post-merge rightly points out that we can just check for
a map or function and still fix the bug.

Also, it seems that we had an existing test which failed to catch the
fact that this didn't work, so fix that to prove the expected
behavior works in the context of a stack, not just when resolving a
function snippet, and add a test which proves the reinstated
constructor validation works as expected.

Change-Id: I21c1868061e37760e1cb27f44ebb7c4ee97fefef
Partial-Bug: #1539737

deleted_lines: snippet = {'str_replace': {'template': {'get_param': 'p_template'}, 'params': {'get_param': 'p_params'}}} snippet_resolved = 'foo-success' stack = parser.Stack(utils.dummy_context(), 'test_stack', tmpl) self.assertEqual(snippet_resolved, self.resolve(snippet, tmpl, stack))

commit_message:
Use MTU value from Neutron in OVS/LB VIF wiring

This patch adds the MTU attached to a Neutron network to
the network model so the VIF plugging code can reference
the MTU and set the correct value for the Neutron network
it is attaching to.

Closes-Bug: #1549408
Change-Id: Ibd4de83e1af193eb2dcd997e6528d2fccaa2979a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/283847/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'network_id': vif['network']['id'], 'mtu': vif['network'].get('mtu')

commit_message:
scenario002: deploy RabbitMQ with SSL

* Manage Puppet OpenStack CI CA and create a common certificate,
  auto-signed.
* Configure RabbitMQ to activate SSL on scenario002
* Configure OpenStack services that run on scenario002 to connect to
  RabbitMQ using SSL protocol.

Change-Id: Ic435078472ba4e0e0eaf04a64e5bcb7aabba7b3d

commit_message:
Allow testing against Ansible dev branch

Adds support for a new environment variable that will trigger
testing against the upstream, development version of Ansible.
This will help us catch breakages in Ansible that would affect
the OpenStack modules.

A new, non-voting job is expected to set this variable.

Change-Id: I7ac84487dd323ef95191fab966244da586b37cd3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/50/285450/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ ${SHADE_ANSIBLE_DEV:-0} -eq 1 ] then # Use the upstream development version of Ansible set +e sudo -E -H -u jenkins tox -eansible -- -d EXIT_CODE=$? set -e else # Use the release version of Ansible set +e sudo -E -H -u jenkins tox -eansible EXIT_CODE=$? set -e fi
deleted_lines: set +e sudo -E -H -u jenkins tox -eansible EXIT_CODE=$? set -e

commit_message:
Track alembic heads

Not strictly necessary, but helps to sequence merges that add
migrations.

This prevents two patches with the same downrev from merging.
Previously, if two patches with the same downrev merged, then a
follow-up patch would be needed to fix one of the migration
scripts, which is never a good thing.

Change-Id: I032b54b800e3e58eba13a3cadd7f7a381c6f4177

commit_message:
Added Base Image field on Node Group Template form

This field allows to choice an image (including empty image choice)
for node group template
Also added Base Image field in Node Group Template details page

Change-Id: I87420c489664301dac3f6cad3abc06c97b0e8029
Closes-bug: 1528182

added_lines: BASE_IMAGE_URL = "horizon:project:data_processing.data_image_registry:register" image = forms.DynamicChoiceField(label=_("Base Image"), required=False, add_item_link=BASE_IMAGE_URL) def populate_image_choices(self, request, context): try: all_images = saharaclient.image_list(request) plugin, hadoop_version = workflow_helpers.\ get_plugin_and_hadoop_version(request) details = saharaclient.plugin_get_version_details(request, plugin, hadoop_version) choices = [('', '')] choices.extend([(image.id, image.name) for image in all_images if (set(details.required_image_tags). issubset(set(image.tags)))]) except Exception: exceptions.handle(request, _("Unable to fetch image choices.")) choices = [] if not choices: choices.append(("", _("No Images Available"))) return choices image_id = None if not context["general_image"] \ else context["general_image"] use_autoconfig=context['general_use_autoconfig'], image_id=image_id)

Removing defaults values from cli.

We should keep all our defaults in one place and avoid duplicating it.
Let's keep it in dict.

commit_message:
Replace "Triggered" state by "Pending" state

This commit only applies to documentation, state name
must be updated in code accordingly.

Change-Id: I027fd55d968c12992d800de3657543be417c71b0
Related-Bug: #1548377

commit_message:
optimization threshold spec

Allow decision engine pass strategy parameters, like optimization
threshold, to selected strategy.

blueprint: optimization-threshold
Change-Id: I555e0eb4c79bcf6644fe9a991f6597a7a0123331
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher-specs refs/changes/88/274688/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================== Optimization Threshold ====================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/watcher/+spec/optimization-threshold Allow decision engine pass strategy parameters, like optimization threshold, to selected strategy. Problem description =================== Currently all parameters used in strategy are hard coded, end user can't modify them unless change the source code. E.g. THRESHOLD of strategy outlet_temp_control is critical and fixed as 35.0, so we can't tune it for specific usage case without source code changing. Use Cases ---------- As an operator. I want to tune the strategy parameter in an easy way for my cloud. I wish I can change it via watcher command line to achieve the best solution. Project Priority ----------------- Not relevant because Watcher is not in the big tent so far. Proposed change =============== Need following to enable strategy parameter: * Add new parameter to 'watcher audit-template-create', like '-p par_str, --parameters par_str'. End user can specify all strategy parameters in string, e.g. "threshold=45.0,repeat=10". * When 'watcher audit-create', decison engine would configure selected strategy with this parameter before executing it. Alternatives ------------ Add parameter string to 'watcher audit-create', so that one audit template can produce multiple audits with different strategy parameters. Low level implementation remains same. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Audit template creation API: POST /v1/audit_templates is changed, so that extra strategy parameters string is accepted in request body. Security impact --------------- Strategy parameter controls the executing process, and odd parameter probably leads unexpected behavior. This BP enables easy changing of parameter, thus need check against input parameter to make sure it is in reasonable range. Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- python-watcherclient need add extra command line for parameter string. End user need be aware of this for strategy parameter tuning. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: edwin-zhai Work Items ---------- * Add extra command line in python-watcherclient, so that strategy parameter can be specified with 'watcher audit-template-create' * When 'watcher audit-create', parameter string should be used to configure the selected strategy object. * Each strategy class need define a new function, 'configure', to parse parameter string and set all parameters, e.g. threshold. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Adds unit and functional test for strategy parameter. Documentation Impact ==================== Need update the watcher API doc and user guide. References ========== None History ======= None

commit_message:
Fix neutron-nova notifications

In our neutron.conf we configure both keystone v2 and v3 options,
which confuses the keystoneclient code responsible for deciding
which to use.  For whatever reason, having it talk to the
unversioned keystone endpoint and letting the client decide which
version that way makes it happy.  Except that we write a wrong
value for project_name, which makes it unhappy again.

This change fixes both of those issues, which allows notifications
to work again.

Change-Id: Ic3a329354d0ed071363183b5e06c0a42d2dd84ad
Closes-Bug: 1519525
(cherry picked from commit 56a141cacbbc76bdd909c02e0e670a97676cb217)

Check the logic of which tests are returned: tests that their status was changed since the last call """ # Setup nagios_synchronizer = NagiosSynchronizerWithMockData(self.conf) # Action service_data1 = {NagiosProps.RESOURCE_NAME: 'compute-0', NagiosProps.SERVICE: 'CPU utilization', NagiosProps.STATUS: 'OK'} service_data2 = {NagiosProps.RESOURCE_NAME: 'compute-1', NagiosProps.SERVICE: 'CPU utilization', NagiosProps.STATUS: 'OK'} service_data3 = {NagiosProps.RESOURCE_NAME: 'compute-1', NagiosProps.SERVICE: 'Uptime', NagiosProps.STATUS: 'OK'} nagios_synchronizer.set_service_datas([service_data1, service_data2, service_data3]) services = nagios_synchronizer._get_changed_services() # Test assertions # Services with status OK should not be returned self.assertIsNotNone(services, 'No services returned') self.assertEqual(0, len(services)) # Action service_data1 = {NagiosProps.RESOURCE_NAME: 'compute-0', NagiosProps.SERVICE: 'CPU utilization', NagiosProps.STATUS: 'WARNING'} service_data2 = {NagiosProps.RESOURCE_NAME: 'compute-1', NagiosProps.SERVICE: 'CPU utilization', NagiosProps.STATUS: 'OK'} service_data3 = {NagiosProps.RESOURCE_NAME: 'compute-1', NagiosProps.SERVICE: 'Uptime', NagiosProps.STATUS: 'OK'} nagios_synchronizer.set_service_datas([service_data1, service_data2, service_data3]) services = nagios_synchronizer._get_changed_services() # Test assertions self.assertIsNotNone(services, 'No services returned') self.assertEqual(1, len(services)) self._assert_contains(service_data1, services) # Action service_data1 = {NagiosProps.RESOURCE_NAME: 'compute-0', NagiosProps.SERVICE: 'CPU utilization', NagiosProps.STATUS: 'CRITICAL'} service_data2 = {NagiosProps.RESOURCE_NAME: 'compute-1', NagiosProps.SERVICE: 'CPU utilization', NagiosProps.STATUS: 'WARNING'} service_data3 = {NagiosProps.RESOURCE_NAME: 'compute-1', NagiosProps.SERVICE: 'Uptime', NagiosProps.STATUS: 'OK'} nagios_synchronizer.set_service_datas([service_data1, service_data2, service_data3]) services = nagios_synchronizer._get_changed_services() # Test assertions self.assertIsNotNone(services, 'No services returned') self.assertEqual(2, len(services)) self._assert_contains(service_data1, services) self._assert_contains(service_data2, services) # Action services = nagios_synchronizer._get_changed_services() # Test assertions self.assertIsNotNone(services, 'services is None') self.assertEqual(0, len(services)) def test_get_changes_and_get_all(self): """Check get_changes and get_all functionalities """ # Setup nagios_synchronizer = NagiosSynchronizerWithMockData(self.conf) # Action service_data1 = {NagiosProps.RESOURCE_NAME: 'compute-0', NagiosProps.SERVICE: 'CPU utilization', NagiosProps.STATUS: 'WARNING'} service_data2 = {NagiosProps.RESOURCE_NAME: 'compute-1', NagiosProps.SERVICE: 'CPU utilization', NagiosProps.STATUS: 'OK'} service_data3 = {NagiosProps.RESOURCE_NAME: 'compute-1', NagiosProps.SERVICE: 'Uptime', NagiosProps.STATUS: 'OK'} nagios_synchronizer.set_service_datas([service_data1, service_data2, service_data3]) services = nagios_synchronizer._get_changed_services() # commit_message:
Update for "nightly" functional ui tests.

Small minor improvements, code cleaning and overall testing.

The job is now voting as part of the pep8 job, so this extra job can get
removed.

commit_message:
Component registry improvements

Change-Id: I046d67931ca9453eb8864cc4e85d04c0584a8b5a
Implements: blueprint component-registry-improvements
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-specs refs/changes/68/275568/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================== Component registry improvements =============================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/component-registry-improvements Improve current Fuel component registry functionality with possibility of describing complex rules in incompatible/requires relations and restrict plugins on `Settings` and `Network` tabs. -------------------- Problem description -------------------- Currently plugin which provide components for wizard can be enabled\disabled bypassing wizard configuration. For example: if DVS is disabled option on wizard, user still can turn-on it in settings without vmware hypervisor. Also current components DSL model can't cover complex logical cases. For instance: vmware requires one of network backends: NSXv or DVS, but current `requires` relation handle items only with `AND` operator. ---------------- Proposed changes ---------------- * Provide restrictions for plugin sections on `Settings` and `Network` tabs. * Implement `expression` logic for incompatible\requires relations. It should work in same way as for restrictions. Web UI ====== Need to be changed accordingly to support plugin restrictions on Settings and Network tabs. Nailgun ======= Data model ---------- Remove old wizard_metadata field based on [1]_ REST API -------- N/A Orchestration ============= N/A RPC Protocol ------------ N/A Fuel Client =========== N/A Plugins ======= Plugin developer should clearly describe restriction with other plugin in environment_config.yaml file. For example: Fuel Library ============ N/A ------------ Alternatives ------------ * Restrictions for plugin sections can be generated based on compatibility matrix, but it's much more complicated implmentation. -------------- Upgrade impact -------------- N/A --------------- Security impact --------------- Expressions has limited set of operators (or, and, not, ()) and shouldn't have impact on security. -------------------- Notifications impact -------------------- N/A --------------- End user impact --------------- N/A ------------------ Performance impact ------------------ N/A ----------------- Deployment impact ----------------- N/A ---------------- Developer impact ---------------- N/A --------------------- Infrastructure impact --------------------- N/A -------------------- Documentation impact -------------------- There is should be notice in plugin SDK about describing restrictions in plugin environment DSL model and about possability to write expressions for components incompatible\requires relations. -------------- Implementation -------------- Assignee(s) =========== Primary assignee: * Andriy Popovych <apopovych@mirantis.com> Other contributors: * Anton Zemlyanov <azemlyanov@mirantis.com> Mandatory design review: * Vitaly Kramskikh (vkramskikh@mirantis.com) * Igor Kalnitsky <ikalnitsky@mirantis.com> Work Items ========== * Provide restrictions handling for plugin section on UI * Provide expressions handling for incompatible/requires relations for validation in Nailgun. * Provide expressions handling for incompatible/requires relations in UI for better UX on wizard tab. Dependencies ============ * Component registry [0]_. ------------ Testing, QA ------------ TBD Acceptance criteria =================== TBD ---------- References ---------- .. [0] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/component-registry .. [1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1533765 .. [2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1527312 .. [3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel-plugins/+bug/1537998

commit_message:
Add composite alarm usage description

blueprint composite-threshold-rule-alarm

Change-Id: I6cf69db4f27ff59de3ed79dd15c6cc92cd5f2d67
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/21/280121/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Composite rule Alarm ==================== The *composite* type alarm allow users specifying a composite rule to define an alarm with multiple triggering conditions, which combined with *and*, *or* relationships. The composite rule is composed with multiple threshold rules or gnocchi rules, the composite form alarm request form is like:: { "name": "test_composite", "type": "composite", "composite_rule": { "and": [THRESHOLD_RULE1, THRESHOLD_RULE2, { 'or': [THRESHOLD_RULE3, GNOCCHI_RULE1, GNOCCHI_RULE2, GNOCCHI_RULE3] }] } } The sub rule in composite_rule is same as a threshold rule in threshold alarm or gnocchi rule in gnocchi alarm, but need a required *type* field to specify the rule type, a simple sample is like:: { "threshold": 0.8, "meter_name": "cpu_util", "type": "threshold" } The composite rule can support threshold rules and gnocchi rules meanwhile.

added_lines: @utils.arg('id', metavar='<NAME or ID>', help=_('Name or ID of stack to get the environment for.')) def do_environment_show(hc, args): """Returns the environment for the specified stack.""" fields = {'stack_id': args.id} try: env = hc.stacks.environment(**fields) except exc.HTTPNotFound: raise exc.CommandError(_('Stack not found: %s') % args.id) else: print(yaml.safe_dump(env, indent=2))

commit_message:
Add separate process for Data Service copy

Data Service currently blocks when copying a file, which makes
any new requests wait until this copy finishes. This patch changes
it by starting a new process for the copy, leaving Data Service
free to respond to any new requests that it might get.

Partially implements: blueprint data-service-migration

Change-Id: I6fdeb5b6f957b25ff4a554aad37d0d3685fac9b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/64/279164/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import multiprocessing size = os.stat(self.current_copy['file_path']).st_size 'bytes_copied': self.current_size + size, return { 'bytes_copied': self.total_size, 'total_progress': 100, 'current_file_path': '', 'current_file_progress': 100 } dest_path = file_item['name'].replace(src, dest) self.current_copy = {'file_path': dest_path, self._start_copy_and_wait(file_item['name'], dest_path) mode = os.stat(dir_item).st_mode size = os.stat(file_item).st_size def _start_copy_and_wait(self, src_file, dest_file): process = multiprocessing.Process(target=shutil.copy2, args=(src_file, dest_file)) process.start() previous_bytes = 0 retries = 0 while process.is_alive(): current_bytes = self.get_progress()['bytes_copied'] if current_bytes == previous_bytes: if retries > 3: process.terminate() else: retries += 1 time.sleep(0.5) elif self.cancelled: process.terminate() else: retries = 0 previous_bytes = current_bytes time.sleep(0.5)
deleted_lines: (mode, ino, dev, nlink, uid, gid, size, atime, mtime, ctime) = os.stat(self.current_copy['file_path']) return {'total_progress': 100} else: # NOTE(ganso): sleep in order to allow data service to receive # and reply concurrent requests time.sleep(0.01) file_path = file_item['name'].replace(src, dest) self.current_copy = {'file_path': file_path, shutil.copy2(file_item['name'], file_item['name'].replace(src, dest)) (mode, ino, dev, nlink, uid, gid, size, atime, mtime, ctime) = os.stat(dir_item) (mode, ino, dev, nlink, uid, gid, size, atime, mtime, ctime) = os.stat(file_item)

Fix 'code-block' tag format issues

Modify 'code-block' tag format so that the following python code
could be showed exactly, and reformat the more than 79 chars of lines.

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "neutron: enable nova-event-callback by default""

This reverts commit d8357912cfd1519b94ae8fe01bc6ad3c583a5d0f.

A fix is coming that will make this work properly, and we definitely
want notifications turned on.

Change-Id: Id049078c288979551d8ca11810be2fcf538a0f42

commit_message:
Add func tests for COPY and service tokens

Adds functional tests to validate correct authorization of COPY
where Destination-Account points at a second reseller prefix
that requires a service token to access.

Change-Id: I271e09f15689d00786ed14d636b0afbc5058d806
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/21/227421/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if self.headers: headers.update(self.headers) def test_copy_cross_reseller_accounts(self): # Setup self.prepare_request('PUT', container='cc') resp = retry(self.do_request) self._assert_is_authed_response('PUT', 'cc', None, resp) self.prepare_request('PUT', container='cc', obj='oo') resp = retry(self.do_request) self._assert_is_authed_response('PUT', 'cc', 'oo', resp) self.prepare_request('PUT', container='cc', obj=None, use_service_account=True, x_auth_token=self.SET_TO_USERS_TOKEN, x_service_token=self.SET_TO_SERVICE_TOKEN) resp = retry(self.do_request, service_user=5) self._assert_is_authed_response('PUT', 'cc', None, resp) # Test normal copy (mostly to test that this functional test can # generate a valid request) self.prepare_request('COPY', container='cc', obj='oo', headers={'Destination': 'cc/dest-o'}) resp = retry(self.do_request) self._assert_is_authed_response('COPY', 'cc', 'dest-o', resp) self.prepare_request('COPY', container='cc', obj='oo', headers={'Destination': 'cc/dest-o', 'Destination-Account': 'AUTH_test'}) resp = retry(self.do_request) self._assert_is_authed_response('COPY', 'cc', 'dest-o', resp) # Test copy with service token self.prepare_request('COPY', container='cc', obj='oo', headers={'Destination': 'cc/dest-o', 'Destination-Account': 'SERVICE_test'}, x_auth_token=self.SET_TO_USERS_TOKEN, x_service_token=self.SET_TO_SERVICE_TOKEN) resp = retry(self.do_request, service_user=5) self._assert_is_authed_response('COPY', 'cc', 'dest-o', resp) # Test copy to SERVICE, but use user's token self.prepare_request('COPY', container='cc', obj='oo', headers={'Destination': 'cc/dest-o', 'Destination-Account': 'SERVICE_test'}, x_auth_token=self.SET_TO_USERS_TOKEN) resp = retry(self.do_request) self._assert_not_authed_response('COPY', 'cc', 'dest-o', resp) # Cleanup self.prepare_request('DELETE', container='cc', obj='oo') resp = retry(self.do_request) self._assert_is_authed_response('DELETE', 'cc', 'oo', resp) self.prepare_request('DELETE', container='cc', obj='dest-o') resp = retry(self.do_request) self._assert_is_authed_response('DELETE', 'cc', 'dest-o', resp) self.prepare_request('DELETE', container='cc', obj=None) resp = retry(self.do_request) self._assert_is_authed_response('DELETE', 'cc', None, resp) self.prepare_request('DELETE', container='cc', obj='oo', use_service_account=True, x_auth_token=self.SET_TO_USERS_TOKEN, x_service_token=self.SET_TO_SERVICE_TOKEN) resp = retry(self.do_request, service_user=5) self._assert_is_authed_response('DELETE', 'cc', 'oo', resp) self.prepare_request('DELETE', container='cc', obj=None, use_service_account=True, x_auth_token=self.SET_TO_USERS_TOKEN, x_service_token=self.SET_TO_SERVICE_TOKEN) resp = retry(self.do_request, service_user=5) self._assert_is_authed_response('DELETE', 'cc', None, resp)

commit_message:
Add two server-migration commands and bump migration-list command

1. Add two new commands
Add nova client server-migration-list and server-migration-show

2. Bump and old command
Add migration_type field for migration-list command

Partially implements blueprint live-migration-progress-report

commit_message:
No longer necessary to specify jackson-core-asl in spark classpath

Versions 1.3.1 and 1.6.0 of spark in the spark standalone plugin
will work correctly without having jackson-core-asl-1.8.8.jar
specified in the classpath for the driver and executors. This
was necessary for spark 1.0.0 (but did not break 1.3.1 or 1.6.0)

Change-Id: Ic146bf2df98e684c0ac49e11f6608c95fa926d2b
Partial-implements: blueprint remove-spark-100

commit_message:
Remove API races on replication methods

There is a potential window of opportunity where races can happen in the
API on replication related actions, this patch removes those windows of
opportunities using compare-and-swap for DB updates.

Races have been removed in following actions:

- os-enable_replication
- os-disable_replication
- os-failover_replication

In volume/api.py they relate to following methods:

- enable_replication
- disable_replication
- failover_replication

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/232599/

Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: I1ccfb4895e74ba3fc7c6ec0b6957f7bb614a98df
Closes-Bug: #1493419
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/41/221441/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(jdg): details like sync vs async and replica count are to be set # via the volume-type and config files. # Loop until we make a decission on whether to go forward with the # enabling or raise and error # TODO(geguileo): Once we are using versioned objects we should change # this to use volume.conditional_update and remove the id from the # condition valid_rep_status = ('disabled', None) expected = {'replication_status': valid_rep_status, 'id': volume['id']} while not db.conditional_update(ctxt, objects.Volume.model, {'replication_status': 'enabling'}, expected): # If we haven't been able to update the DB, but we should have # according to the volume info we have, it means it is out of sync # with DB, so we update it. if volume['replication_status'] in valid_rep_status: volume = objects.Volume.get_by_id(ctxt, volume['id']) # If when we tried to update DB the replication_status was not # disabled but now it is, we try to update it again if volume['replication_status'] in valid_rep_status: continue 'curr_state': volume['replication_status']}) self.volume_rpcapi.enable_replication(ctxt, volume) disabled_status = ('disabled', None) # Loop until we make a decission on whether to go forward with the # disabling or raise and error # TODO(geguileo): Once we are using versioned objects we should change # this to use volume.conditional_update and remove the id from the # condition while not db.conditional_update(ctxt, objects.Volume.model, {'replication_status': 'disabled'}, {'replication_status': 'enabled', 'id': volume['id']}): # If we haven't been able to update the DB, but we should have # according to the volume info we have, it means it is out of sync # with DB, so we update it. if volume['replication_status'] == 'enabled': volume = objects.Volume.get_by_id(ctxt, volume['id']) # If it's enabled now but wasn't when we tried to update db # try again if volume['replication_status'] == 'enabled': continue # If when we tried to update DB the replication_status was not # disabled but now it is we don't need to do anything as it's # already disabled if volume['replication_status'] in disabled_status: return {'valid_states': 'enabled', 'curr_state': volume['replication_status']}) self.volume_rpcapi.disable_replication(ctxt, volume) def failover_replication(self, ctxt, volume, secondary=None): # Loop until we make a decission on whether to go forward with the # failover or raise and error # TODO(geguileo): Once we are using versioned objects we should change # this to use volume.conditional_update and remove the id from the # condition while not db.conditional_update( ctxt, objects.Volume.model, {'replication_status': 'enabling_secondary'}, {'replication_status': 'enabled', 'id': volume['id']}): # If we haven't been able to update the DB, but we should have # according to the volume info we have, it means it is out of sync # with DB, so we update it. if volume['replication_status'] == 'enabled': volume = objects.Volume.get_by_id(ctxt, volume['id']) # If it's enabled now but wasn't when we tried to update db # try again if volume['replication_status'] == 'enabled': continue {'valid_states': 'enabled', 'curr_state': volume['replication_status']}) self.volume_rpcapi.failover_replication(ctxt, volume, secondary)
deleted_lines: # NOTE(jdg): details like sync vs async # and replica count are to be set via the # volume-type and config files. # Get a fresh ref from db and check status volume = self.db.volume_get(ctxt, volume['id']) # NOTE(jdg): Set a valid status as a var to minimize errors via typos # also, use a list, we may want to add to it some day # TODO(jdg): Move these up to a global list for each call and ban the # free form typing of states and state checks going forward valid_rep_status = ['disabled'] rep_status = volume.get('replication_status', valid_rep_status[0]) if rep_status not in valid_rep_status: 'curr_state': rep_status}) vref = self.db.volume_update(ctxt, volume['id'], {'replication_status': 'enabling'}) self.volume_rpcapi.enable_replication(ctxt, vref) valid_disable_status = ['disabled', 'enabled'] # NOTE(jdg): Just use disabled here (item 1 in the list) this # way if someone says disable_rep on a volume that's not being # replicated we just say "ok, done" rep_status = volume.get('replication_status', valid_disable_status[0]) if rep_status not in valid_disable_status: {'valid_states': valid_disable_status, 'curr_state': rep_status}) vref = self.db.volume_update(ctxt, volume['id'], {'replication_status': 'disabling'}) self.volume_rpcapi.disable_replication(ctxt, vref) def failover_replication(self, ctxt, volume, secondary=None): valid_failover_status = ['enabled'] rep_status = volume.get('replication_status', 'na') if rep_status not in valid_failover_status: {'valid_states': valid_failover_status, 'curr_state': rep_status}) vref = self.db.volume_update( ctxt, volume['id'], {'replication_status': 'enabling_secondary'}) self.volume_rpcapi.failover_replication(ctxt, vref, secondary)

commit_message:
Trivial: Update image_list v2 docs

This api doc is clearly copied from v1, we should update it to reflact v2 API.
Added 'shared' param description.

Change-Id: I73d36e3a2a0448c28edab788a9340fd46177f8ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/91/286491/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :param shared: Return shared images if True If public, private and shared are all True or all False then all images are returned. All arguments False is equivalent to no filter and all images are returned. All arguments True is a filter that includes all public, private and shared images which is the same set as all images.
deleted_lines: If public and private are both True or both False then all images are returned. Both arguments False is equivalent to no filter and all images are returned. Both arguments True is a filter that includes both public and private images which is the same set as all images.

commit_message:
Erase more data so grub install will succeed

destroy_disk_metadata should destroy a bit more data than expected
if we want to be sure grub won't conflict with remaining bits of
filesystem.

grub probes the hard drive to find remaining partition or filesystem.
If it find something, it will refuse to install itself on the disk.
According to my test, zeroing the first 1MB of the disk is enough to
avoid the issue.

References:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/284347/
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1310883
Partial-Bug: 1550604

Change-Id: Id59fa5a06b9115c0f9afc09aae95daaac97e2fac

commit_message:
Avoid swapspace uuid's time_mid collision with minix fs magic

mkswap defaults to generating a random UUID. The second field
of that UUID, time_mid, is written at offset 0x410. If a
random generated value yields to have 0x8f13 in this very
location, blkid mistakenly treats the block device as a minix
filesystem superblock and then fails reading the structure.

This bug is triggered with probability of 2^-16.

We can work around this bug by re-running mkfs several times
unless blkid is able to examine the newly-created filesystem.

Change-Id: I13209faeb4e1d2798b7b0e0e8382e43803998d36
Closes-Bug: #1550227
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent refs/changes/18/285318/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if fs_type == 'swap': # NOTE(dbilunov): force swap header to be created at the # offset of 0. Otherwise, blkid would fail fetching the # UUID value. fs_options += ' -f '

commit_message:
API: Improve os-migrateLive input parameters

This is os-migrateLive API changes:

    * 2.25 - Make block_migration to support 'auto' value, remove
             disk_over_commit.

Partially implements: blueprint making-live-migration-api-friendly
APIImpact
DocImpact
Change-Id: Ibb0d50f0f7444028ef9d0c294aea41edf0024b31

commit_message:
Moved CORS middleware configuration into oslo-config-generator

Default values for CORS middleware have been moved from paste.ini
into oslo's config generator. All configuration options in use will
now live in one place.

Change-Id: I9d31c574de6af4c7598c90d7e128cd9fa7273672

commit_message:
Change default policy to allow create_samples

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/234823/ has broken heat
integration tests as the default policy no longer allows
to create_samples without admin privileges.

Change-Id: I28980ff4cd82950bc713da519e0e49b62fc77a22
Closes-Bug: #1551383

Drop root for neutron

Updates to ensure commands run in the neutron containers
are done as the 'neutron' user rather than root.

Partially-Implements: blueprint drop-root

subject: Convert the container job to a noop

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-26 14:26:34.000000000', 'files': ['toci_gate_test.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/647f1800b79542845d02bf9e088fc87462c233ca', 'message': 'Convert the container job to a noop

This job has been failing for over a month, timing out after
nearly 3 hours. As a result it is wasting 1/4 of our resources and
delaying ci reporting back to developers by up to an hour for all
patches.

Cause it to fail fast until it is fixed. We could remove it altogether

Change-Id: I45209839a2fbde0970a7f9f6f7fb89f6b1bcdc2f

commit_message:
Convert the container job to a noop

This job has been failing for over a month, timing out after
nearly 3 hours. As a result it is wasting 1/4 of our resources and
delaying ci reporting back to developers by up to an hour for all
patches.

Cause it to fail fast until it is fixed. We could remove it altogether
but this would make it more difficult to test when trying to get it
back up and running.

Change-Id: I45209839a2fbde0970a7f9f6f7fb89f6b1bcdc2f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/25/285325/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO : remove this when the containers job is passing again exit 1

commit_message:
Remove Unnecessary port type check

When the configuration variable was decelared for the
'vif_type' the configuration choices were configured.

This means that if one of the chosen options is not configured
when the service starts it will exit with an exception.

The patch removes a check that is not valid.

Change-Id: I0c23f89732c645389c271b53af6b0221049b95eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/96/286596/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enable the Load Balancer v2 events

In this change set, add the following new event definitions to
receive the events of LBaaS v2.

a. loadbalancer
b. listener
c. healthmonitor

These events can be used for billing when the users use the LBaaS
service.

Co-Authored-By: Zi Lian Ji <jizilian@cn.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I6db28a934bac4a1d83cc1b61d879dc2b16989b3a
Implements: blueprint lbaas-v2-enablement

This variable doesn't make sense in the context of an undercloud

commit_message:
Unset DIB_YUM_REPO_CONF before running undercloud install

This variable doesn't make sense in the context of an undercloud
install because we're not in a chroot so there's no reason to copy
repos in.  It also causes a confusing error message when it's set
because it tries to copy files over themselves.  For the sake of
sanity, let's just always unset it.

Change-Id: Ieb500d21828abcf56277ce056c1051d36bf4e460
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/44/284444/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix create_pool_member and update_pool_member
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-07 21:51:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/network/v2/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/network/v2/_proxy.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/test_proxy_base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/5ab84d47202f17d799c23ec49ec0181097495114', 'message': 'Fix create_pool_member and update_pool_member

The PoolMember resource requires path_args to include the owning
Pool ID on all requests (see [1]). The proxy methods for delete,
find, get and list already support path_args. However, the create
and update proxy methods do not.

While this patch set fixes the network v2 proxy interfaces for
create_pool_member and update_pool_member, there is still an
underlying problem with the processing of path_args that causes
the REST API to fail. Namely, pool_id is passed in the request
body when it should only be used in the URL. Changes related
to [2] should fix the remaining problem.

[1] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-networking-v2-ext.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219840/

Change-Id: I882276ac8201e30c8f27673f418713c93d97ce09
'}]
commit_message:
Fix create_pool_member and update_pool_member

The PoolMember resource requires path_args to include the owning
Pool ID on all requests (see [1]). The proxy methods for delete,
find, get and list already support path_args. However, the create
and update proxy methods do not.

While this patch set fixes the network v2 proxy interfaces for
create_pool_member and update_pool_member, there is still an
underlying problem with the processing of path_args that causes
the REST API to fail. Namely, pool_id is passed in the request
body when it should only be used in the URL. Changes related
to [2] should fix the remaining problem.

[1] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-networking-v2-ext.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219840/

Change-Id: I882276ac8201e30c8f27673f418713c93d97ce09
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/80/264980/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _add_path_args_for_verify(self, path_args, method_args, expected_kwargs): if path_args is not None: for key in path_args: method_args.append(path_args[key]) expected_kwargs['path_args'] = path_args self._add_path_args_for_verify(path_args, method_args, expected_kwargs) expected_result="result", path_args=None, **kwargs): method_kwargs = the_kwargs.copy() expected_kwargs = the_kwargs.copy() self._add_path_args_for_verify(path_args, method_args, expected_kwargs)
deleted_lines: if path_args is not None: for key in path_args: method_args.append(path_args[key]) expected_kwargs = {"path_args": path_args} expected_result="result", **kwargs): method_kwargs = the_kwargs expected_kwargs = the_kwargs

commit_message:
Remove keystone admin token

Admin token has been deprecated upstream. It will be removed in O. We
switch over to the new `keystone-manage bootstrap` method for creating
the initial admin user, role, and project.

commit_message:
Remove unused pngmath Sphinx extension

There's no RST file that uses ".. math" and thus
the pngmath Sphinx extension is not used and can
get removed.

Change-Id: I3ea4b529025c8ac3c4092f3720124647861e6668

commit_message:
show any existing tags on commit receiving new tag

Move the details about the target commit to the top of the output and
add info about any existing tags as well as the branch the commit is on.

Change-Id: Ic84079a842377c2f947d5c4a6e2e0e0e9c33c915
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
use zuul cache dir, if it is set or present

Let the validation and list-changes code use the zuul cache directory,
if ZUUL_CACHE_DIR is set or if /opt/git is present (the default for the
CI systems).

Change-Id: Ia6cf24d1361c1112c37e5aeec05546b19798bbbd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
skip some tests if the repo was not in the previous release

When a new repo is added to a deliverable, some of the checks we are
doing fail because the new repo does not have the old tags for previous
releases. Skip those steps to avoid failing.

Change-Id: Id5ce7fea8a54841ecbd313c04e42152a1846a2d6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Cleans up vmutils and pathutils

Commit I7007f77f51755cf3f8ab85402d39f10d7af749b1 included changes
to the nova HyperVDriver. Due to this, PathUtils no longer needs
to extend SMBUtils and VMUtils no longer has to implement the
enable_vm_metrics_collection method.

Change-Id: Ia2a4d1e1ab715e95bba9f12c62ce6b0a5a205c91

commit_message:
Creates baseutils module

Creates BaseUtils class, which contains the _get_wmi_obj and
_get_wmi_conn methods, commonly used in most of the utils
classes.

Caches the WMI connections, as they do not have to be unique.

Sets the WMI _conn object, the Msvm_VirtualSystemManagementService
as object attributes, as they are constantly used and there is no
need to instantiate them every time.

Partial-Bug: #1505196

Change-Id: Ieee7b9e587424f2a95aee85389adfaabf4032779
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/44/268144/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Data pipelines in extensions

Data pipelines in extensions for deployment and provisioning
serialized data.

Data pipeline is an attribute of Extension - a list of Classes
which provide one of (or both) methods: process_provisioning,
process_deployment. They can be used to change provisioning or
deployment data just before running the action.

Change-Id: Ie778c7ee6c9eb2abe2783b886ee6be481eccd2dc
Implements: blueprint data-pipeline

commit_message:
Fix resource ordering for Ceilometer controller task

Mongodb should be prepared before ceilometer installation.
Swift requires ceilometer to be installed.

Change-Id: Ic3483eff8a189d51d6d61d30708652fb6457961c
Closes-bug: #1548936

Only report releases as part of the "stable" series if they are not
pre-releases and they are not the first release in a series.

commit_message:
better handling of stable flag

Only report releases as part of the "stable" series if they are not
pre-releases and they are not the first release in a series.

Tag releases as either "release" for full releases, or "development
milestone" or "release candidate" for pre-releases.

Change-Id: I493b8390170ecd52b9033e0f33329d840e1f087d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add a checklist for creating a new plugin

includes steps for both infra and osc changes.

Change-Id: I35ae2eb29cff87f5c971e64badd2927fc9a59bf4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/44/284944/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Checklist for adding new OpenStack plugins ========================================== Creating the initial plugin described above is the first step. There are a few more steps needed to fully integrate the client with openstackclient. Add the command checker to your CI ---------------------------------- #. Modify the section of ``zuul/layout.yaml`` related to your repository to add ``osc-plugin-jobs`` to the list of job templates for your project. This job checks that to see if any new commands are: duplicated, missing entry points, or have overlap; across all openstackclient plugins. #. Update ``jenkins/scripts/check-osc-plugins.sh`` to include your new library to be installed from source. This is essential in running the previously mentioned check job. Simply add ``install_from_source python-fooclient`` to the block of code where all other clients are installed. Changes to python-openstackclient --------------------------------- #. In ``doc/source/plugins.rst``, update the `Adoption` section to reflect the status of the project. #. Update ``doc/source/commands.rst`` to include objects that are defined by fooclient's new plugin. #. Update ``doc/source/plugin-commands.rst`` to include the entry point defined in fooclient. We use `sphinxext`_ to automatically document commands that are used. #. Update ``test-requirements.txt`` to include fooclient. This is necessary to auto-document the commands in the previous step. .. _sphinxext: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/stevedore/sphinxext.html

commit_message:
Modify the number of params of hypermetro in HuaweiDriver

When attaching or detaching hypermetro volume, the initialization
instance has three parameters, but the function definition has five
parameters.

Change-Id: I8343a7b75e02962c321a838de148acc54498f952
Closes-Bug: #1545971

commit_message:
Better doc for installing the fuel-devops

- split the instructions for different versions (2.5.x, 2.9.x)
- ensure that the fuel-qa branch aligned with the iso version
- improved description for KVM related checks
- every command can run unattended
- following them produce a reliable installation (a poor man's literate
  programming)
- works well with isend-mode.el
- remove bashism (source for .)
- update dependencies
- added SQLite database documentation

Change-Id: Id7a4f02cafcf03ee518a298709bc1a2b0c15b56f
Closes-Bug: #1542308
Related-Bug: #1547035
Co-Authored-By: Daniele Pizzolli <daniele.pizzolli@create-net.org>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/15/276715/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tests which have been refactored since the last major release. Look here `how to migrate`_ from older devops.`fuel-devops repository on github <https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-devops>`_.The installation procedure can be implemented via PyPI in Python virtual environment (suppose you are using *Ubuntu 12.04* or *Ubuntu 14.04*): sudo apt-get install --yes git \Devops installation in `virtualenv <http://virtualenv.readthedocs.org/en/latest/virtualenv.html>`_ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ sudo apt-get install --yes python-virtualenv libpq-dev libgmp-dev 2. In case you are using *Ubuntu 12.04* let's update pip and virtualenv, otherwise you can skip this step3. In oder to store the path where your Python virtualenv will be located create your working directory and use the following environment variable. If it is not specified, it will use the current working directory: export WORKING_DIR=$HOME/working_dir mkdir $HOME/working_dir 4. Create virtualenv for the *devops* project (e.g. ``fuel-devops-venv``). Note: the related directory will be used for the ``VENV_PATH`` variable: .. code-block:: bash cd $WORKING_DIR sudo apt-get install --yes python-virtualenv virtualenv --system-site-packages fuel-devops-venv .. note:: If you want to use different devops versions in the same time, you can create several different folders for each version, and then activate the required virtual environment for each case. For example:: virtualenv --system-site-packages fuel-devops-venv # For fuel-devops 2.5.x virtualenv --system-site-packages fuel-devops-venv-2.9 # For fuel-devops 2.9.x . fuel-devops-venv/bin/activate pip install git+https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-devops.git@2.9.11 --upgradeversions in `fuel-devops <https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-devops/tags>`_Give current user permissions to use libvirt: do not forget to log out and log back in. pg_version=$(dpkg-query --show --showformat='${version;3}' postgresql) pg_createcluster $pg_version main --start * in 2.9.x version, default <user> and <db> are **fuel_devops** .. code-block:: bash sudo -u postgres createuser -P fuel_devops sudo -u postgres psql -c "CREATE ROLE fuel_devops WITH LOGIN PASSWORD 'fuel_devops'" sudo -u postgres createdb fuel_devops -O fuel_devops .. code-block:: bash sudo -u postgres createuser -P devops sudo -u postgres psql -c "CREATE ROLE devops WITH LOGIN PASSWORD 'devops'" sudo -u postgres createdb devops -O devops After the database setup, we can install the django tables and data: .. code-block:: bash django-admin.py syncdb --settings=devops.settings django-admin.py migrate devops --settings=devops.settingsThe following section covers only Intel platform. This option is enabled by default in the KVM kernel module. If the file ``qemu-system-x86.conf`` does not exist, you have to create it. cat /etc/modprobe.d/qemu-system-x86.conf sudo apt-get install --yes cpu-checker sudo modprobe kvm_intelDepending on the Fuel release, you may need a different repository.For 6.1 and later, the *fuel-qa* is required: git clone https://github.com/openstack/fuel-qa.. note:: It is recommended to use a stable branch (e.g. stable/7.0) .. code-block:: bash git clone https://github.com/openstack/fuel-main -b stable/7.0 In case of 6.0 or earlier, please use *fuel-main* repository: git clone https://github.com/openstack/fuel-main cd fuel-main/ 2. Install requirements (follow :ref:`DevOpsPyPIvenv` section for the WORKING_DIR variable) .. code-block:: bash . $WORKING_DIR/fuel-devops-venv/bin/activateNext, you need to define several variables for the future environment: * the path where is located your iso (e.g. $WORKING_DIR/fuel-community-7.0.iso) * the number of nodes instantiated for the environment (e.g. 5) export ISO_PATH=$WORKING_DIR/fuel-community-7.0.iso export NODES_COUNT=5libvirt, defaults is ``fuel_system_test``). export ENV_NAME=fuel_system_test export VENV_PATH=$WORKING_DIR/fuel-devops-venv If you want to use separated files for snapshots you need to use libvirtd in version >= 1.2.12 and set env variable. This change will switch snapshots created by libvirt from internal to external mode... note:: External snapshots by default uses ~/.devops/snap directory to store memory dumps. If you want to use other directory you can set SNAPSHOTS_EXTERNAL_DIR variable.Repositories 'fuel-main' and 'fuel-qa', that contain system tests, must use different Python virtual environments, for example:Please check other settings in *devops.settings*, especially the connection settings to the database.* if you are using system tests on CI, please configure your CI to use new Python venv, or export path to the new Python venv in the variable ``VENV_PATH`` (follow :ref:`DevOpsPyPIvenv` section for the WORKING_DIR variable): .. code-block:: bash export VENV_PATH=$WORKING_DIR/fuel-devops-venv-2.9 unsupported configuration: host doesn't support invariant TSC*. See: `Bug 1133155 <https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1133155>`_.

In case you are using *Ubuntu 12.04* let's update pip and virtualenv, otherwise you can skip this step4. Create virtualenv for the *devops* project virtualenv --system-site-packages <path>/fuel-devops-venv .. note:: If you want to use different devops versions in the same time, you can create several different folders for each version, and then activate required virtual environment for each case. For example: :: virtualenv --system-site-packages <path>/fuel-devops-venv # For fuel-devops 2.5.x virtualenv --system-site-packages <path>/fuel-devops-venv-2.9 # For fuel-devops 2.9.x <path> represents the path where your Python virtualenv will be located. (e.g. ~/venv). In case of 6.0 or earlier, please use *fuel-main* repository. For 6.1 and later, the *fuel-qa* is required. git clone https://github.com/openstack/fuel-qa # fuel-main for 6.0 and earlier2. Install requirements source <path>/fuel-devops-venv/bin/activateNext, you need to define several variables for the future environment export ISO_PATH=<path_to_iso> export NODES_COUNT=<number_nodes>libvirt, defaults is =fuel_system_test=) export ENV_NAME=<name_of_env> .. code-block:: bash export VENV_PATH=<path>/fuel-devops-venv If you want to use separated files for snapshots you need to use libvirtd in version >= 1.2.12 and set env variable. This change will switch snapshots created by libvirt from internal to external mode... note:: External snapshots by default uses ~/.devops/snap directory to store memory dumps. If you want to use other directory you can set SNAPSHOTS_EXTERNAL_DIR variable.Repositories 'fuel-main' and 'fuel-qa', that contain system tests, must use different Python virtual environments, for example:Please check other settings in *devops.settings*, especially the connection settings to the database.* if you are using system tests on CI, please configure your CI to use new Python venv, or export path to the new Python venv in the variable VENV_PATH: export VENV_PATH=<path>/fuel-devops-venv-2.9 unsupported configuration: host doesn't support invariant TSC*. See: `Bug 1133155 <https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1133155>`_.

commit_message:
Use more generic "type" name instead of "murano_class"

Because the're going to be many different types of classes
(like meta-classes) it is reasonable to distinguish murano_class
from a "type", that can refer to any type of class (type)

Change-Id: I05993eb7a37627aaeacbc6c828250791e145d706

Change-Id: I7f16f5f15c3f02418867cd87d8363cf434e6149c

commit_message:
Add ability to set up Swift container-sync realms

This will allow the specification of container-sync realms via the
swift_container_sync_realms variable (documented in the
defaults/main.yml within the os_swift role).

Creating a conf file that is then used to enable and utilise
container-sync Realms within Swift.

Change-Id: I7f16f5f15c3f02418867cd87d8363cf434e6149c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/45/286545/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If we've specified a container-sync realm lets setup container-sync - name: "Swift container-sync configuration" config_template: src: "{{ item.src }}" dest: "{{ item.dest }}" owner: "{{ swift_system_user_name }}" group: "{{ swift_system_group_name }}" mode: "0644" config_overrides: "{{ item.config_overrides }}" config_type: "{{ item.config_type }}" with_items: - src: "container-sync-realms.conf.j2" dest: "/etc/swift/container-sync-realms.conf" config_overrides: "{{ swift_container_sync_realms_conf_overrides }}" config_type: "ini" when: > swift_container_sync_realms is defined notify: Restart swift proxy services

commit_message:
Add extra config yaml files for big switch agents.

This change adds extra config yaml files for big switch agent
and big switch lldp.

This change is mainly for compute nodes. The changes related
to controller nodes are landed at e78e1c8d9b5a7ebf327987b22091bff3ed42d1c1

This change also removes the neutron_enable_bigswitch_ml2 flag. Instead,
User needs to specify NeutronMechanismDrivers: bsn_ml2 in environment file.

Previous discussion about this change can be found at an abandoned
review request https://review.openstack.org/#/c/271940/

Depends-On: Iefcfe698691234490504b6747ced7bb9147118de

Change-Id: I81341a4b123dc4a8312a9a00f4b663c7cca63d7c
(cherry picked from commit ef73827d736124bf609b0c06ee6d0d05353bd596)

Add required packages to ironic-conductor container

commit_message:
Add invert option to rule conditions

Some conditions do not have a native counterparts, so we need a way
to invert them (aka NOT operation). This patch adds a new generic
parameter "invert", defaulting to False.

Change-Id: I50342689ba52346a5a4fbf362536b629fc688986

added_lines: --- features: - Introspection rules conditions got a new generic "invert" parameter that inverts the result of the condition.

commit_message:
Use assertEqual/Greater/Less/IsNone

Instead of using assertFalse(A * B) / assertTrue(A * B),
developers should use assertEqual/NotEqual/Less//Greater
The * operator: '==', '<', '>'

Change-Id: Ic4952ee034c8c8f6da70403cb767bb027058eeb0

commit_message:
Fixed over-application of webroot in disabled image panel

In haste to accommodate webroot settings for angular routing in the
images panel, we neglected to notice that the angular routing already
takes the base tag into account, and removes the base from the route path.
As a result, we can code a static path in and it will survive webroot
settings just fine.

To test: try using the Images panel with webroot both as / and as something
else (on your devstack).

Fixes-Bug: 1549530
Change-Id: I48479e88acf35c259016a615221c805bd46af291

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-11 16:27:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/bcfd953c40ea97a7cbe5b6a1aa51b6ffe4414fec', 'message': 'Shadow users - Shadow federated users

"Shadow users: unified identity" implementation:
Federated users have a idp_id, protocol_id, display name, and a unique ID asserted
by the identity provider. These are the minimal pieces of data required to identify
returning users and provide them with a consistent identity.

Note: Shadowing LDAP users will be completed in a different patch

bp shadow-users

Change-Id: Ieb582947038b4a75ef4237939ad8a90079b38aa8

commit_message:
Shadow users - Shadow federated users

"Shadow users: unified identity" implementation:
Federated users have a idp_id, protocol_id, display name,
and a unique ID asserted by the identity provider. These
are the minimal pieces of data required to identify
returning users and provide them with a consistent identity.

Note: the following work items left will be completed in a
separate patch:
* Allow concrete role assignments for federated users
* Shadowing LDAP users

bp shadow-users

Change-Id: Ieb582947038b4a75ef4237939ad8a90079b38aa8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/62/279162/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_create_federated_identity_table(self): federated_identity_table = 'federated_identity' self.upgrade(91) self.assertTableDoesNotExist(federated_identity_table) self.upgrade(92) self.assertTableColumns(federated_identity_table, ['id', 'identity_id', 'idp_id', 'protocol_id', 'unique_id', 'display_name'])

commit_message:
XenAPI: Workaround for 6.5 iSCSI bug

XenServer 6.5 doesn't handle iSCSI connections correctly, due to a bug
introduced when changing the backend support.
This has been fixed upstream for the next version of XenServer, but
fix in Nova as well to ensure users of 6.5 can use Cinder-provided
volumes

Change-Id: I74e690228690d42e247f948e8be8e82ba1bf4c5b
Closes-bug: 1502929
(cherry picked from commit 46c55399c04513c1e6b939be46d71036cd81c4fb)
Depends-On: Iefa5b16a3fa1789ed583426ea47ebb22e6cb571e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/41/281341/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import versionutils if _requires_backend_kind(session.product_version) and sr_type == 'iscsi': params['backend-kind'] = 'vbd' def _requires_backend_kind(version): # Fix for Bug #1502929 version_as_string = '.'.join(str(v) for v in version) return (versionutils.is_compatible('6.5', version_as_string))

commit_message:
Add some obvious detail to nw_info warning log

When we log a warning due to a missing nw_info cache we do not mention
that this log is occuring due to a missing nw_info cache. Add this
detail to make debugging easier for someone unfamiliar with this
codepath.

Change-Id: I33ec36398e95fc060e28faad86ed4c65007d6f26

subject: Add overcloud-base element
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-29 01:29:38.000000000', 'files': ['elements/overcloud-base/README.md', 'elements/overcloud-compute/element-deps', 'elements/overcloud-network-midonet/element-deps', 'elements/overcloud-contrail-controller/element-deps', 'elements/overcloud-cinder-volume/element-deps', 'elements/overcloud-base/element-deps', 'elements/overcloud-base/install.d/package-installs-overcloud-base', 'elements/overcloud-controller/element-deps', 'elements/overcloud-base/pkg-map', 'elements/overcloud-ceph-storage/element-deps'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-puppet-elements/commit/b217175340dfb10bdbaf158c00ba2535afd4bde9', 'message': 'Add overcloud-base element

commit_message:
Add overcloud-base element

This patch adds a new overcloud-base element that currently
installs the python-ipaddr package. Per t-h-t commit 45be848
python-ipaddr is now required for network validations on
all nodes.

Change-Id: Ia617f44b4673b89202e5e5cdcac9b50f46b3e6c8
Closes-bug: #1551048
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-puppet-elements refs/changes/58/285858/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: overcloud-base

commit_message:
Projects acting as domains

Moves all domain operations to project table, mapping domains
to projects that have the is_domain attribute set to True. Removes all
manager references to domain driver calls.

The V8 legacy wrapper ensures that manager calls for projects
acting as a domain end up calling the underlying driver domain
methods, so that older drivers are still be supported.

The domain driver methods and the domain table will be removed in
follow-up patches.

Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz <samueldmq@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Young <ayoung@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Henry Nash <henryn@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Change-Id: Ib22a0f3007cb7ef6b4df6f48da5f4d018e905f55
Implements: bp reseller

commit_message:
Add string checking param to LBaaSv2 healthmonitor

Neutron LBaaSv2 healthmonitor allows validation of the HTTP return code within
the member reply.
Loadbalancers allow an addional validation, where the existence of a string
within the member response determines the member health status.
This patch adds the necessary param for the validation above.

Change-Id: I538897cfdaac0f16443482bc508278944ed2d50f
Partial-Bug: #1523231

commit_message:
Deprecated tox -downloadcache option removed

Caching is enabled by default from pip version 6.0

More info:
https://testrun.org/tox/latest/config.html#confval-downloadcache=path
https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/pip_install/#caching

Change-Id: I5a5c337da09e7fed32c30a2e193c23960cc4b7a2

commit_message:
Remove unused pngmath Sphinx extension

There's no RST file that uses ".. math" and thus
the pngmath Sphinx extension is not used and can
get removed.

Change-Id: I3ea4b529025c8ac3c4092f3720124647861e6668

subject: Stop storing ramdisk logs with the introspection data
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-11 15:20:30.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/process.py', 'releasenotes/notes/no-logs-stored-data-6db52934c7f9a91a.yaml', 'ironic_inspector/test/test_process.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector/commit/e86cec3b07ac7f660f3daaa8c408c3fbec456cce', 'message': "Stop storing ramdisk logs with the introspection data

Ramdisk logs are huge (and may potentially be VERY huge) and clutter the output

Change-Id: I0e7f1f647e60711f84d7883caab5ce8b14d6184f
"}]
commit_message:
Stop storing ramdisk logs with the introspection data

Ramdisk logs are huge (and may potentially be VERY huge) and clutter the output
for 'introspection data save'. They might even potentially expose unwanted
information to a user.

Change-Id: I0e7f1f647e60711f84d7883caab5ce8b14d6184f

commit_message:
Implement nova protectable plugin

Change-Id: I1cadbb6e6075114d7acb7456d3412faa13d001ba
Closes-Bug: #1551124
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/karbor refs/changes/32/286532/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import six from novaclient import client as nc from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from smaug import exception from smaug import resource from smaug.i18n import _LE, _LI from smaug.services.protection.plugins.protectables import utils from smaug.services.protection import protectable_plugin LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) nova_client_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('nova_endpoint', help='The info of the nova endpoint. ' 'Format is: separated values of the form: ' '<service_type>;<endpoint_url>;<endpoint_type>'), cfg.StrOpt('nova_catalog_info', default='compute;nova;publicURL', help='Info to match when looking for nova in the service ' 'catalog. Format is: separated values of the form: ' '<service_type>;<service_name>;<endpoint_type> - ' 'Only used if nova_endpoint is unset'), ] cfg.CONF.register_opts(nova_client_opts, group='nova_client') class ServerProtectablePlugin(protectable_plugin.ProtectablePlugin): """Protectable plugin implementation for server from nova. """ _SUPPORT_RESOURCE_TYPE = "OS::Nova::Server" _NOVACLIENT_VERSION = '2' @property def client(self): if not self._client: self._client = self._create() return self._client def _get_url(self): '''Return the url of nova endpoint.''' if cfg.CONF.nova_client.nova_endpoint is None: return utils.parse_service_catalog_info( 'nova_catalog_info', cfg.CONF.nova_client.nova_catalog_info, self._context.service_catalog ) else: return utils.parse_service_endpoint( 'nova_endpoint', cfg.CONF.nova_client.nova_endpoint, self._context.project_id ) def _create(self): try: service_type, url, endpoint_type = self._get_url() except Exception: LOG.error(_LE("Get nova service endpoint url failed.")) raise LOG.info(_LI('Creating nova client with url %s.'), url) extensions = nc.discover_extensions(self._NOVACLIENT_VERSION) args = { 'project_id': self._context.project_id, 'auth_url': self._context.auth_url, 'auth_token': self._context.auth_token, 'extensions': extensions, 'endpoint_type': endpoint_type } client = nc.Client(self._NOVACLIENT_VERSION, **args) client.client.set_management_url(url) return client def get_resource_type(self): return self._SUPPORT_RESOURCE_TYPE def get_parent_resource_types(self): return ["OS::Keystone::Project", ] def list_resources(self): try: servers = self.client.servers.list(detailed=False) except Exception as e: LOG.exception(_LE("List all servers from nova failed.")) raise exception.ListProtectableResourceFailed( type=self._SUPPORT_RESOURCE_TYPE, reason=six.text_type(e)) else: return [resource.Resource(type=self._SUPPORT_RESOURCE_TYPE, id=server.id) for server in servers] def fetch_child_resources(self, parent_resource): # Utilize list_resource here, cause its function is # listing resources of given project return self.list_resources()

commit_message:
Logging configuration options at startup

This patch adds logging all configurations options on DEBUG level,
once at service startup.

Change-Id: Id700198284a4140850338d2722f434b3dd2baef8

commit_message:
Implement re-authentication for swift driver

Enable re-authentication when downloading or uploading images.
If single tenant store is used then request the new token
for service user.
If multi tenant store is used then request the new token with
trusts.

Note: Both features are available for Keystone V3 API only.
If store.auth_version is not '3' then use old approach to
receive Swift Connections.

DocImpact: Describe how to enable/disable re-authentication
           and add notes about Keystone v3 support only.

Implements bp prevention-of-401-in-swift-driver

Change-Id: Id4e479e29ae8f71ff93f769246989b4b180f5c68

commit_message:
params.pp: Fix opencontrail_plugin_package name

params.pp defines opencontrail_plugin_package as
'neutron-plugin-contrail' on line 39 and 130.
However, the actual package name is 'neutron_plugin_contrail', as per
https://github.com/Juniper/contrail-neutron-plugin/blob/master/setup.py#L13

manifests/plugins/opencontrail.pp defines the Package resource as
'neutron-plugin-contrail', but in the spirit of consistency, rename the
resource as well.

The specs tests are also addressed.

We deploy this in production and can attest to it.

Change-Id: I6847c88d1811f58fa2d19a0eda16321a4e5f2060
Closes-Bug: #1543022
Signed-off-by: Martin Millnert <martin@millnert.se>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/18/277318/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $opencontrail_plugin_package = 'neutron_plugin_contrail'

commit_message:
Remove unused pngmath Sphinx extension

There's no RST file that uses ".. math" and thus
the pngmath Sphinx extension is not used and can
get removed.

Change-Id: I3ea4b529025c8ac3c4092f3720124647861e6668

commit_message:
Simplify action initialization

This patch simplifies the action initialization and deserialization so
that 'user', 'project', 'domain' are not explicitly passed through the
intialization interface.

Change-Id: I69658e246175bae5f4e803447f2ccdcdb1910551
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/51/286351/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __new__(cls, target, action, context, **kwargs): def __init__(self, target, action, context, **kwargs): self.context = context self.user = context.user self.project = context.project self.domain = context.domain } return cls(record.target, record.action, context, **kwargs) obj = cls(target, action, ctx, **kwargs)
deleted_lines: def __new__(cls, target, action, context=None, **kwargs): def __init__(self, target, action, context=None, **kwargs): if not context: self.user = kwargs.get('user') self.project = kwargs.get('project') self.domain = kwargs.get('domain') params = { 'user': self.user, 'project': self.project, 'domain': self.domain, 'is_admin': False } self.context = req_context.RequestContext.from_dict(params) else: self.user = context.user self.project = context.project self.domain = context.domain self.context = context 'user': record.user, 'project': record.project, 'domain': record.domain, } return cls(record.target, record.action, context=context, **kwargs) obj = cls(target, action, context=ctx, **kwargs)

commit_message:
Fix kick-start for postgresql

A recent changeset (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/271096 )
broke kick-start for PostgreSQL since it forgot to add a
postgresql.conf file in the conf directory.
This has been created and corresponding medium flavors added.

The flavors created by redstack were also changed to facilitate
testing of non-MySQL datastores in that changeset.
Using string IDs was removed from it when it was discovered
that it cause the kilo tests to fail.

This changeset puts them back (with proper handling for kilo) and
consolidates all the creation in one spot.

The vertica.conf file was also fixed to use the proper resize flavor.

Closes-Bug: #1549604
Change-Id: I326080f45a119c0e377498a7e9dfb1c8f39c5dbb

commit_message:
Add suport for module maintenance commands

This adds support in the python API and Trove CLI
for module maintenance commands.  These commands include:

    - module-list
    - module-show
    - module-create
    - module-update
    - module-delete

Partially Implements: blueprint module-management
Change-Id: I54d37025275dee4731ad49ebbd21612c4464e4c4

commit_message:
support OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE environment variable

Using the OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE environment variable if it exists,
otherwise falling back to the TROVE_ENDPOINT_TYPE environment
variable.

Change-Id: I74f108a32877a5f80bd65961ca965f9f686379d2
Closes-Bug: #1541515

commit_message:
Revert "Remove Murano installation from Fuel from box"

This partially reverts commit 21fcbbc5aedbdb746553346b77413a4671fd1b02.

This patch is continuation of I24643c06fbd5b578d6ea75cca44128623204b5ce
and reverts UI part, because of [1]

The new way of removing Murano is described here:
https://review.openstack.org/275124

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-February/087634.html

Closes-bug: #1551215

Change-Id: Id443286c2197d2aa2f2bde3cbb293c1237ab08ab

subject: [zmq] Dynamic port range is ignored
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-29 14:55:37.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_zmq.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/76ab2c4f624204f181eff50c27c3aa192f14fc2a', 'message': '[zmq] Dynamic port range is ignored

If we specify the default range to pyzmq function,
means default values are the same as pyzmq default values
we fallback to bind-0 system call which is not appropriate
for us as it binds in maximal range > 1024.

https://github.com/zeromq/pyzmq/blob/master/zmq/sugar/socket.py#L212

Change-Id: Idacd99d83c8fb9ad222a7bda187fa67a9b0348da
Closes-Bug: #1550104
'}]
commit_message:
[zmq] Dynamic port range is ignored

If we specify the default range to pyzmq function,
means default values are the same as pyzmq default values
we fallback to bind-0 system call which is not appropriate
for us as it binds in maximal range > 1024.

https://github.com/zeromq/pyzmq/blob/master/zmq/sugar/socket.py#L212

Change-Id: Idacd99d83c8fb9ad222a7bda187fa67a9b0348da
Closes-Bug: #1550104

subject: Adds a bash script that operators will use during upgrades
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 07:50:09.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/upgrade-non-controller.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/fe6e4b910fa72d364fa9a25bc4ac95374a186e0a', 'message': 'Adds a bash script that operators will use during upgrades

Part of the upgrades workflow requires that operators will update
the non controller nodes by invoking an upgrade script. This
adds a utility bash script for this purpose.

The ability to deliver a custom upgrade script is allowed with a
--script override. This is delivered to the node before the upgrade

Change-Id: I06826c7c8b5515208a5883d6c99016101b302cd6
